trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Notify Users

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send push notifications to users in Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and the .NET API for the backend.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send push notifications to users in Azure. Code samples written in Objective-C and the .NET API for the backend.

trans-unit.source: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Push notification support in Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a specific app user on a specific device.

trans-unit.source: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients and to generate notifications, as shown in the guidance topic <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: An ASP.NET WebAPI backend is used to authenticate clients and to generate notifications, as shown in the guidance topic <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is also the prerequisite to the <linkText>Secure Push (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is also the prerequisite to the <linkText>Secure Push (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the <linkText>Mobile Services version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Mobile Services as your backend service, see the <linkText>Mobile Services version</linkText><title></title> of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Open the Single Page view app you created in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Open the Single Page view app you created in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In this section we assume that your project is configured with an empty organization name.
trans-unit.target: In this section we assume that your project is configured with an empty organization name.

trans-unit.source: If not, you will need to prepend your organization name to all class names.
trans-unit.target: If not, you will need to prepend your organization name to all class names.

trans-unit.source: In your Main.storyboard add the components shown in the screenshot below from the object library.
trans-unit.target: In your Main.storyboard add the components shown in the screenshot below from the object library.

trans-unit.source: Username: A UITextField with placeholder text, Enter Username, immediately beneath the send results label and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the send results label.
trans-unit.target: Username: A UITextField with placeholder text, Enter Username, immediately beneath the send results label and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the send results label.

trans-unit.source: Password: A UITextField with placeholder text, Enter Password, immediately beneath the username text field and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the username text field.
trans-unit.target: Password: A UITextField with placeholder text, Enter Password, immediately beneath the username text field and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the username text field.

trans-unit.source: Check the Secure Text Entry option in the Attribute Inspector, under Return Key.
trans-unit.target: Check the Secure Text Entry option in the Attribute Inspector, under Return Key.

trans-unit.source: Log in: A UIButton labeled immediately beneath the password text field and uncheck the Enabled option in the Attributes Inspector, under Control-Content
trans-unit.target: Log in: A UIButton labeled immediately beneath the password text field and uncheck the Enabled option in the Attributes Inspector, under Control-Content

trans-unit.source: WNS: Label and switch to enable sending the notification Windows Notification Service if it has been setup on the hub.
trans-unit.target: WNS: Label and switch to enable sending the notification Windows Notification Service if it has been setup on the hub.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Windows Getting Started</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Windows Getting Started</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: GCM: Label and switch to enable sending the notification to Google Cloud Messaging if it has been setup on the hub.
trans-unit.target: GCM: Label and switch to enable sending the notification to Google Cloud Messaging if it has been setup on the hub.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Android Getting Started</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Android Getting Started</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: APNS: Label and switch to enable sending the notification to the Apple Platform Notification Service.
trans-unit.target: APNS: Label and switch to enable sending the notification to the Apple Platform Notification Service.

trans-unit.source: Recipent Username:A UITextField with placeholder text, Recipient username tag, immediately beneath the GCM label and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the GCM label.
trans-unit.target: Recipent Username:A UITextField with placeholder text, Recipient username tag, immediately beneath the GCM label and constrained to the left and right margins and beneath the GCM label.

trans-unit.source: Some components were added in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Some components were added in the <linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (iOS)</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Ctrl drag from the components in the view to ViewController.h and add these new outlets.
trans-unit.target: Ctrl drag from the components in the view to ViewController.h and add these new outlets.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.h, add the following #define just below your import statements. Substitute the placeholder with the Destination URL you used to deploy your app backend in the previous section. For example, http://you_backend.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.h, add the following #define just below your import statements. Substitute the placeholder with the Destination URL you used to deploy your app backend in the previous section. For example, http://you_backend.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: In your project, create a new Cocoa Touch class named RegisterClient to interface with the ASP.NET back-end you created.
trans-unit.target: In your project, create a new Cocoa Touch class named RegisterClient to interface with the ASP.NET back-end you created.

trans-unit.source: Create the class inheriting from NSObject.
trans-unit.target: Create the class inheriting from NSObject.

trans-unit.source: Then add the following code in the RegisterClient.h.
trans-unit.target: Then add the following code in the RegisterClient.h.

trans-unit.source: In the RegisterClient.m update the @interface section:
trans-unit.target: In the RegisterClient.m update the @interface section:

trans-unit.source: Replace the @implementation section in the RegisterClient.m with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Replace the @implementation section in the RegisterClient.m with the following code.

trans-unit.source: The code above implements the logic explained in the guidance article <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title> using NSURLSession to perform REST calls to your app backend, and NSUserDefaults to locally store the registrationId returned by the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: The code above implements the logic explained in the guidance article <linkText>Registering from your app backend</linkText><title></title> using NSURLSession to perform REST calls to your app backend, and NSUserDefaults to locally store the registrationId returned by the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Note that this class requires its property authorizationHeader to be set in order to work properly.
trans-unit.target: Note that this class requires its property authorizationHeader to be set in order to work properly.

trans-unit.source: This property is set by the ViewController class after the log in.
trans-unit.target: This property is set by the ViewController class after the log in.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.h, add a #import statement for RegisterClient.h.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.h, add a #import statement for RegisterClient.h.

trans-unit.source: Then add a declaration for the device token and reference to a RegisterClient instance in the @interface section:
trans-unit.target: Then add a declaration for the device token and reference to a RegisterClient instance in the @interface section:

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, add a private method declaration in the @interface section:
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, add a private method declaration in the @interface section:

trans-unit.source: The following snippet is not a secure authentication scheme, you should substitute the implementation of the createAndSetAuthenticationHeaderWithUsername:AndPassword: with your specific authentication mechanism that generates an authentication token to be consumed by the register client class, e.g. OAuth, Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The following snippet is not a secure authentication scheme, you should substitute the implementation of the createAndSetAuthenticationHeaderWithUsername:AndPassword: with your specific authentication mechanism that generates an authentication token to be consumed by the register client class, e.g. OAuth, Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Then in the @implementation section of ViewController.m add the following code which adds the implementation for setting the device token and authentication header.
trans-unit.target: Then in the @implementation section of ViewController.m add the following code which adds the implementation for setting the device token and authentication header.

trans-unit.source: Note how setting the device token enables the log in button.
trans-unit.target: Note how setting the device token enables the log in button.

trans-unit.source: This is becasue as a part of the login action, the view controller registers for push notifications with the app backend.
trans-unit.target: This is becasue as a part of the login action, the view controller registers for push notifications with the app backend.

trans-unit.source: Hence, we do not want Log In action to be accessible till the device token has been properly set up.
trans-unit.target: Hence, we do not want Log In action to be accessible till the device token has been properly set up.

trans-unit.source: You can decouple the log in from the push registration as long as the former happens before the latter.
trans-unit.target: You can decouple the log in from the push registration as long as the former happens before the latter.

trans-unit.source: In ViewController.m, use the following snippets to implement the action method for your Log In button and a method to send the notification message using the ASP.NET backend.
trans-unit.target: In ViewController.m, use the following snippets to implement the action method for your Log In button and a method to send the notification message using the ASP.NET backend.

trans-unit.source: Update the action for the Send Notification button to use the ASP.NET backend and send to any PNS enabled by a switch.
trans-unit.target: Update the action for the Send Notification button to use the ASP.NET backend and send to any PNS enabled by a switch.

trans-unit.source: In function ViewDidLoad, add the following to instantiate the RegisterClient instance and set the delegate for your text fields.
trans-unit.target: In function ViewDidLoad, add the following to instantiate the RegisterClient instance and set the delegate for your text fields.

trans-unit.source: Now in AppDelegate.m, remove all the content of the method application:didRegisterForPushNotificationWithDeviceToken: and replace it with the following to make sure that the view controller contains the latest device token retrieved from APNs:
trans-unit.target: Now in AppDelegate.m, remove all the content of the method application:didRegisterForPushNotificationWithDeviceToken: and replace it with the following to make sure that the view controller contains the latest device token retrieved from APNs:

trans-unit.source: Finally in AppDelegate.m, make sure you have the following method:
trans-unit.target: Finally in AppDelegate.m, make sure you have the following method:

trans-unit.source: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).
trans-unit.target: In XCode, run the app on a physical iOS device (push notifications will not work in the simulator).

trans-unit.source: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password.
trans-unit.target: In the iOS app UI, enter a username and password.

trans-unit.source: These can be any string, but they must both be the same string value.
trans-unit.target: These can be any string, but they must both be the same string value.

trans-unit.source: Then click Log In.
trans-unit.target: Then click Log In.

trans-unit.source: You should see a pop-up informing you of registration success.
trans-unit.target: You should see a pop-up informing you of registration success.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: In the *Recipient username tag text field, enter the user name tag used with the registration from another device.
trans-unit.target: In the *Recipient username tag text field, enter the user name tag used with the registration from another device.

trans-unit.source: Enter a notification message and click Send Notification.
trans-unit.target: Enter a notification message and click Send Notification.

trans-unit.source: Only the devices that have a registration with the recipient user name tag receive the notification message.
trans-unit.target: Only the devices that have a registration with the recipient user name tag receive the notification message.

trans-unit.source: It is only sent to those users.
trans-unit.target: It is only sent to those users.
